div.l: As he were on the quakke / or on the pose
To bedde he goth / and with hym goth his wyf
As any Iay / she liht was / and Iolyf
So was hir Ioly whistil / wel I wet
The cradil / at hir beddis feet she set
To rokken and to yeve / the child sowke
And whan that dronken / was al in the crowke
To bedde wente / the douhter right a noon
To bedde goth Alayn / and also Iohn
Ther nas no more / hem neded no dwale
This miller hath so wisly / bibbed ale
That as an hors / he snorteth in his slep
Ne of his taile be hynde / he took no keep
His wyf bar hym a burdon / a ful stronge
Men myhten here routhyng heere a forlonge
The wenche routeth / eek par companye
Alayne the clerk / that herde this melodye
He poked Iohn / ⁊and seyde / slepyst thou
Herdist thou euyr / swilk a song or now
Lo swilk a couplyng / is a melle hem alle
A wilde fier / mot on here bodies falle
Who herkenyd euyr swilk / a ferly thyng
They shal have the flour of ille endyng͗e
This longe nyht / ther tydes me na reste
But yit no fors / al shal be for the beste
For Iohn seyde he / alswa mot I thryue
Yif that I may / yon wenche wol I swive
Som esement has / lawe I shapen vs
For Iohn ther is a lawe / that says thus
That yif a man̄ / in oo poynt be greuyd
That in a nothir / he shal be releved
Our corn is stolyn / sothly / it is no nay
And we han had / an ille fitt to day
And syn I shal haue noon amendement
Ageyn my los / I wil haue esement
Bi goddis soule / it shal non othir be
This Iohn Answerde / Aleyn avise the
